description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n >= 2) gives number of r-bicoverings of an n-set with k blocks.
comments: A bicovering is r-bicovering if intersection of every two blocks contains at most one element.
references: I. P. Goulden and D. M. Jackson, Combinatorial Enumeration, John Wiley and Sons, N.Y., 1983.
formula: E.g.f. for number of k-block r-bicoverings of an n-set is exp(-x-1/2*x^2*y)*Sum_{i=0..inf} (1+y)^binomial(i, 2)*x^i/i!.
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 15 2001
